context: the patient was brought into the operating room suite, anesthesia administered via endotracheal tube.
the patient was brought into the operating room suite, anesthesia administered via endotracheal tube.
the crowe-davis mouth gag was inserted in the oral cavity.
the palate was suspended with a red rubber catheter passed through the right nostril.
the mirror was used to visualize the adenoid pad and an adenoid curet was seated against the vomer.
the adenoid pad was removed without difficulty.
several discrete bleeding sites were gently coagulated with electrocautery
the nasopharynx and oral cavity were irrigated.
the patient tolerated the procedure without difficulty and was in stable condition on transfer to recovery.
